body_html:
@Yagun : The name of the variable as far as TensorFlow is concerned is available via the .name property. For example:

matrix_1 = tf.Variable([[1, 2], [3, 4]])
matrix_2 = tf.Variable([[5, 6], [7, 8]])
print(matrix_1.name)  # Will print "Variable:0"
print(matrix_2.name) # Will print "Variable_1:0"

Is that sufficient? If not, could you provide some more detail on what you'd like?

Thanks.

body:
@Yagun : The name of the variable as far as TensorFlow is concerned is available via the `.name` property. For example:

```python
matrix_1 = tf.Variable([[1, 2], [3, 4]])
matrix_2 = tf.Variable([[5, 6], [7, 8]])
print(matrix_1.name)  # Will print "Variable:0"
print(matrix_2.name) # Will print "Variable_1:0"
```

Is that sufficient? If not, could you provide some more detail on what you'd like?

Thanks.
